titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward Bliss Reed Carol Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 05:51
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Thecollection contains: two manuscripts of carols, a single "Noel- Nouveau" and a collection of carols by Raymondus, Curio Parochiae St. Stephani as well as two letters regarding Reed's collection and a notebook Reed kept on his research on the history of carols.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Edward Bliss Reed Carol Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edward Bliss Reed Carol Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, this has been noted in the box-and-folder list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Edward Bliss Reed Carol Collection brings together the manuscript portion of items collected by Edward Bliss Reed. The Yale library system has various other printed items about carols given by Mr. Reed. These have been cataloged separately.

did.unittitle: Raymondus, Curio Parochiae St. Stephani. S'ensuivent plusieurs cantiques..., bound manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full Title: S'ensuivent plusieurs cantiques, ou noels composes les annees 1610, et 1611, Et premierement son faict en dialogue de l'ange, et du Pecheur parlant en la personne de tous Qui se chante a l'air de nova estantione trois basanets et. [Signed: Raymond] f.1-3r [verso blank] - Exorcismus mirabilis efficacia pro his, qui in matrimonio a daemonibus, vel maleficis diabolica arte impediuntur, seu maleficiantur Rubrica. f.4-12r [verso blank] - Poeme de la glorieuse mort, et passion de nostre sauveur, et redempteur Jesus Christ. Autre sur le mesme subiect... [Signed: Raymondus Curio Parr[ochi]ae S[anc]tj Stephani. f.13-21. [Followed by additional carols and poems, written by the same author between 1610 and 1634] MS, probably in the author's hand. [No place, 1610-1634] 1-29, 29 bis, 30-42 leaves numbered in a later hand. 29 cm.; Lettered on spine: Raymond. Noels. and Noels. France.; Half-leather with tan marbled boards.

did.unittitle: Noel - Nouveau. [France] MS in an unidentified hand.
Clouzot, G. ALS to L. Clugnet. Niort

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In regard to the authorship of Vieux noèls, with a ms note by Clugnet at the end; Removed from Vieux noèls. [n.p., ca. 1895] Vnell.v67.

did.unittitle: Morin, Jean Baptiste. ALS in French to Canon Bourlier. Paris

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanking Bourlier for his critisisms of La Monnoye et ses noëls bourguignons ; With reply from Bourlier to Morin, 1906 Mar 11, Dijon. Both removed from his Morin's La Monnoye et ses noëls bourguignons...

did.unittitle: Reed, Edward Bliss, 1872-1940. Notebook containing miscellaneous notes on carols. England

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The notes appear to have been taken largely in English libraries; 140p.; Two pages torn away, stubs remain; In pencil and in ink; On cover: E.B. Reed; Yellow Cloth.
